header.title: The best Fence & Concrete installation company in Corona
bullets: FREE custom 3D Fence & Concrete quotes that you can design, review and edit online!
Responsive, quick and friendly customer service from end-to-end!
Transparent pricing and our quality assurance.
Beautiful, high-quality Fence & Concretes for your property built by skilled local craftsmen.

Yelp.title: After talking to Mark on the phone, he was very helpful, very knowledgeable. Mark set up a zoom meeting on my cellphone to show them a picture of what they will be working with of putting up a new Vinly Fence. Mark gave us numbers of Quotes and different options, also Mark followed up all the time with my husband. I would highly recommend Ergeon to my friends and family. We definitely will do business with them again.
Yelp.name: Nadine M.
Yelp.description: I would highly recommend Ergeon to my friends and family.

Google.title: I have been working with Kelly so far on getting some quotes as I am looking into updating my landscaping. She has been very helpful and attentive, very quick to respond which you don't see very often nowadays with construction or fabrication. Definitely has been a huge help.
Google.name: Roberto P.
Google.description: Very quick to respond which you don't see very often nowadays.

regulations.title: Permits & Regulations
regulations.description: See the undefined Permits & Regulations for undefined

faq.side-yard: 3 feet on street side, 7 feet interior side. Special setbacks for fencing in the street side yard of properties located on Main Street
faq.corner-lot-rules: Max 3 feet in corner cut-off triangle areas: 1) on major or secondary street right-of-way lines:  30 feet; 2) on collector street right-of-way lines:  25 feet; 3) on local street right-of-way lines:  20 feet; 4) on alley right-of-way lines: 10 feet

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor.  In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.
